summary_points: 1. On April 7, 2025, Fulvio Conti announced his retirement from Aon plc's Board of Directors, effective after the 2025 Annual General Meeting.
2.  The filing mentions numerous guarantees of Aon plc's senior notes due at various dates from 2025 to 2054, all listed on the New York Stock Exchange.
3. The SEC filing does not include any specific future impacts or risks related to Mr. Conti's departure.

1. Martin Marietta Materials, Inc. announced preliminary, unaudited first-quarter 2025 results on April 10, 2025, showing revenues of $1.353 billion, net earnings attributable to Martin Marietta of $116 million, and adjusted EBITDA of $351 million.
2.  James A.J. Nickolas resigned as Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, effective April 11, 2025, to pursue another opportunity.
3. Robert J. Cardin was appointed Interim Chief Financial Officer, effective April 11, 2025, while the company searches for a permanent replacement.
1. EOG Resources Inc. paid a net cash outflow of $38 million during the first quarter of 2025 for the settlement of financial commodity derivative contracts.

2.  The average NYMEX West Texas Intermediate crude oil price was $71.42 per barrel during the first quarter of 2025, while the average NYMEX natural gas price at Henry Hub was $3.66 per million British thermal units.

3.  EOG's actual realizations for crude oil and natural gas differ from NYMEX prices due to factors like delivery location, quality, and revenue adjustments;  deliveries from their Brent Linked Gas Sales Contract are expected to commence in January 2027.
1. On April 17, 2025, Sheryl A. Lisowski was appointed interim Chief Financial Officer of Fastenal Company, succeeding the previous CFO.
2. Ms. Lisowski's base salary increased from $320,000 to $440,000, effective April 17, 2025, and her bonus structure was modified.
3.  There are no current or proposed transactions requiring disclosure under Item 404(a) of Regulation S-K involving Ms. Lisowski or her immediate family.
1. EQT Corp. reported a $679 million total loss on derivatives for the three months ending March 31, 2025.

2.  Net cash settlements paid on derivatives totaled $(92) million during the three months ending March 31, 2025, comprised of $(43) million on NYMEX natural gas hedges and $(49) million on basis and liquids hedge positions.
3.  The figures provided are preliminary and subject to change before being included in EQT's Quarterly Report on Form 10-Q for the period ended March 31, 2025, or the corresponding earnings release.
1. On April 10, 2025, Realty Income Corporation closed a $600,000,000 offering of 5.125% Notes due 2035.
2.  The 5.125% Notes due 2035 were sold at 97.721% of principal amount to underwriters, with an initial public price of 98.371% of principal amount plus accrued interest.

3. The offering adds new covenants to the Indenture, including limitations on total and secured debt, debt service coverage, and maintenance of total unencumbered assets, which will remain in effect only as long as any of the 2035 notes are outstanding.
1. On April 10, 2025, Paychex Inc. completed a debt offering totaling $4.2 billion in senior notes, with maturities in 2030, 2032, and 2035.
2.  The offering consisted of $1.5 billion in 5.100% senior notes due 2030, $1.5 billion in 5.350% senior notes due 2032, and $1.2 billion in 5.600% senior notes due 2035.
3. Paychex intends to use the proceeds from the offering to finance the acquisition of Paycor HCM, Inc., with any remaining funds allocated to general corporate purposes.
1. CarMax's net earnings per diluted share in Q4 FY2025 increased by 81.3% year-over-year to $0.58, although this was impacted by a $12 million non-cash lease impairment.
2.  In Q4 FY2025, CarMax bought 269,000 vehicles (a 15.3% YoY increase), with a significant increase in dealer purchases (114.2% YoY increase to 46,000 units).
3. CarMax projects low-single-digit gross profit growth will be sufficient to leverage SG&A in FY2026.
1. Labcorp Holdings Inc. declared a $0.72 per share cash dividend on April 10, 2025, payable on June 11, 2025, to stockholders of record as of May 29, 2025.
2.  Labcorp supported 75% of new drugs and therapeutic products approved by the FDA in 2024 and performed over 700 million tests annually.
3. No specific future impacts or risks were mentioned in this filing.
1. News Corp repurchased approximately US$659,184,186.32 worth of Class A and Class B shares as of April 9th, 2025, under a US$1 billion stock repurchase program.
2. On April 9th, 2025, 21,493,553 Class A shares and 10,607,393 Class B shares were repurchased, totaling US$659,184,186.32.
3.  News Corp's stock repurchase program, announced in an April 9th, 2025 filing, will continue until a total of US$1 billion is spent.
1. Amazon's total revenue for 2024 was $638B, an 11% year-over-year increase from $575B in 2023.
2. Amazon's operating income significantly improved in 2024, increasing 86% year-over-year to $68.6B (a 10.8% operating margin) from $36.9B (a 6.4% operating margin) in 2023.

3.  Amazon is making substantial investments in AI, with triple-digit year-over-year revenue growth in AI and multi-billion-dollar annual revenue run rate, leading to significant upfront capital expenditure.

1. Constellation Brands divested six wine brands to The Wine Group for an expected after-tax gain of approximately $870 million,  reducing fiscal year 2025 net sales by $1.5 billion to $1.6 billion and EPS by $0.25 to $0.30.
2. The company projects $9 billion in operating cash flow and $5 billion in free cash flow from fiscal year 2026 to 2028, along with a new $4 billion share repurchase authorization.

3.  Constellation Brands anticipates a 2% net sales decline in at least one fiscal year between 2026 and 2028, despite expecting over $200 million in annual cost savings by fiscal year 2028 from restructuring.
1. On April 7, 2025, Daniel M. Dickinson resigned from the Caterpillar Inc. Board of Directors, stating no disagreement with the company.
2.  The filing is an 8-K Current Report, filed on April 9, 2025, concerning a director's departure and financial statements.
3. No specific future impacts or risks were mentioned in this section of the filing.
1. As of March 31, 2025, Invesco Ltd.'s preliminary assets under management (AUM) totaled $1,844.8 billion, a 2.3% decrease from the previous month.
2. Unfavorable market returns decreased AUM by $60 billion during March 2025, while net long-term inflows contributed $6.5 billion.
3. Preliminary average total AUM for the quarter ending March 31, 2025, was $1,880.8 billion.

1. Dominion Energy, Inc. and two subsidiaries entered into a $7,000,000,000 Sixth Amended and Restated Revolving Credit Agreement, maturing in April 2030, and amended an existing Sustainability Revolving Credit Agreement, extending its maturity to April 2028 and increasing its commitment to $1,000,000,000, both on April 8, 2025.
2.  The company's total revolving credit facility increased by $1 billion to $8 billion as of April 8, 2025.

3. The agreements include provisions for interest rate adjustments based on benchmarks like SOFR and contain clauses addressing potential Benchmark Transition Events and increased costs associated with regulatory changes, potentially impacting the company's future borrowing costs.
1. Delta Air Lines' operating income decreased by $45 million year-over-year in the March 2025 quarter, reaching $569 million.
2.  Delta's fuel hedge contract losses significantly improved to $20 million in Q1 2025, down from $96 million in Q1 2024.
3. As of March 31, 2025, Delta held $3.1 billion in undrawn revolving credit facilities.
